For all the Account endpoints the access token that was generated for your app (and is visible in the app view) must be used. This token must be added to each request as a header named Authorization whose value starts with Bearer.

Getting access to our APIS as a Developer is as simple as registering your name, and email address to create a secure login account. After you verify your email address with an email delivered to your inbox, you’re ready to start developing your first project!

The registration, access and use to/of the Deutsche Bank Developer Portal website at developer.db.com including the pertinent tools and applications, as made available by Deutsche Bank from time to time in its discretion (the “Developer Portal”) is subject to the following Terms and Conditions (the “Terms and Conditions”). “Deutsche Bank” in the context of these Terms and Conditions means Deutsche Bank AG, Taunusanlage 12, 60325, Frankfurt am Main, Germany. Deutsche Bank may at any time alter these Terms and Conditions without prior notice by publishing new or amended Terms and Conditions on the Developer Portal.
Your Registration to the Developer Portal

The Developer Portal is a discretionary offer by Deutsche Bank. You must register through the website at developer.db.com for access. Deutsche Bank reserves the right to approve registration demands and may reject your application in its discretion without the need to provide any reasons. You agree that you will disclose to Deutsche Bank any actual or potential conflicts of interest with respect to your registration (e.g., if you are already working for, or are affiliated with, a Deutsche Bank competitor or other financial institution).

Any information that you provide in connection with your registration must be correct and complete, and you are responsible for maintaining such information up-to-date and accurate throughout the term of your registration. Upon successful registration, you may be provided with access credential, passwords and other account information (the “Credentials”). The Credentials are, and will remain, the property of Deutsche Bank and you are granted a nontransferable license to use the Credentials for the sole purpose of participating in the Developer Portal. You must keep the Credentials confidential and may not sell, transfer, sublicense, or otherwise disclose your Credentials to any other person or for any other purpose. If you become aware or if you suspect that the confidentiality of your Credentials have been compromised, you are obliged to inform Deutsche Bank without undue delay. You must not attempt to circumvent or modify any Credentials or other security mechanism used by Deutsche Bank in connection with the Developer Portal.
Rules governing your use of the Developer Portal

You are responsible for all activities that occur under usage of your Credentials, regardless whether undertaken by you or someone else. You are obliged to comply with all legal requirements and refrain from creating content that is unlawful or otherwise objectionable, or any content that may be construed as such. Any activity on the Developer Portal or in connection therewith must at all times be in compliance with the Deutsche Bank Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, which can be found here.

You are prohibited from, and you will not engage, in any of the following activities: (a) reverse engineer, disassemble, reconstruct, or decompile any object code of the Developer Platform, any Deutsche Bank test data, the Deutsche Bank API or any other data provided by Deutsche Bank in connection with the Developer Portal (the “DB Content”); (b) attempt unauthorized access to, or use of, Deutsche Bank’s services or systems; (c) damage, disrupt, or otherwise negatively affect the operation of Deutsche Bank’s services or systems; (d) engage in any activity that prevents any other developer from using the DB Content; (e) use any robot, spider, site search or other application to retrieve or index DB Content, (f) collect information about other developers and (g) introduce any viruses or other malicious code.

The PSD2 compliant STET API’s of BNP Paribas Fortis enable PSD2 Certified Third Parties to seamlessly connect with our AISP and PISP features. We warmly invite the general Fintech public to dive into our STET API’s as well!

The PSD2 compliant STET API’s of Hello Bank! enable PSD2 Certified Third Parties to seamlessly connect with our AISP and PISP features. We warmly invite the general Fintech public to dive into our STET API’s as well!

API Firefly lets you see up to 12 months of transaction information from a customer’s account. See what amounts are coming in and out, what currencies are being used, who the customer interacts with, and more.
The BNP Paribas Fortis Openbank API Products range from the much anticipated {psd2bold} endpoints to specific market need solutions.

Two-factor authentication adds an extra layer of security to your account. In addition to your username and password, you’ll need to enter a code that we will send to you via an app on your phone.
Your account has Two-factor Authentication currently enabled and disabling it will mean your account will only need a regular username and password to authenticate.
Use an application on your phone to get two-factor authentication codes when prompted.
Scan this barcode with your app
Scan the image above with the two-factor authentication app on your phone.
Enter the six-digit code from the application
After scanning the barcode image, the app will display a six-digit code that you can enter below.
Open your authentication app and retrieve the code for BNP Paribas Fortis Openbank Portal.
You should receive an SMS with the code on your phone. Use it to complete your login on BNP Paribas Fortis Openbank Portal.
If you don't receive an SMS in the next seconds, re-send it again.
Don't have access to the app?

TEX Hackathon - open up the bank
Warandeberg 8 Montagne du Parc 1000 Brussels, Belgium

Create Account Information consuming applications that offer great added value to your customers and users. BNP’s Account Information Service will enable secure access to all European BNP payments accounts.

By finding out useful information about a customer’s transactions, you get a clear picture of their spending and earning habits. This enables you to approve contracts and purchases quickly, or give customers useful financial breakdowns.
Analyse a customer’s spending and earning patterns to help them to make smarter purchasing decisions. You can also connect customers with providers relevant to their lifestyle and interests.
CustomerInsights checks personal information such as the customer’s phone number, email address, birthdate, and many more.
Accounts gives you a holistic overview of customers account activities over the last 12 months.

Access useful information such as IBAN, BIC and the current account balance of your customer quickly and easily. You can also gain insight into customers’ transaction data, including amounts, dates, counterparties and much more.
Pass phrase minimum length is 8 characters

Hang in there, we’re validating your registration.

Here at BNP Paribas Fortis, we take the safety of your data very serious. A team member is currently making sure you’re one of the good guys. Once your registration passed this manual check, we’ll send you an e-mail confirmation.
Thank you for your patience, we’re looking forward to have you fully on-boarded.
